text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the DUP's opposition to the Protocol, stating: \"The DUP objection was, broadly: - EU law was applying in NI without direct NI democratic consent (\u201cdemocratic deficit\u201d). - The Brake was sold as a constitutional/democratic safeguard: *NI representatives can pull an emergency cord* on significant new goods rules.\" This directly explains why the DUP boycotted the Assembly, linking it to the implementation of the Protocol (which necessitates checks in the Irish Sea) and the desire for a democratic safeguard (the Stormont Brake) against future EU law application.", "criterion_id": "7f2d4371-c1ef-4b44-81d6-c18c43964231"}
